{"step_by_step_thinking": "An oro-antral fistula is a pathological communication between the oral cavity and the maxillary sinus. It can occur due to various reasons, including extraction of the maxillary posterior teeth. The treatment of oro-antral fistula aims to close the communication to prevent sinusitis and other complications. Among the options provided, a buccal mucoperiosteal flap is commonly used to treat oro-antral fistulas. This procedure involves the elevation of a flap from the buccal mucosa and periosteum, which is then rotated and sutured over the fistula.
